quest.name: A Clam to Die For
journal:
 Quest Sync
The strong-willed wife taps her foot in impatience.
objectives: Deliver the oversized tideclam to the hesitant husband.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERWOMAN03351
dialogue.text:
Of all the useless...
You there, have you seen a timid mouse of a man cowerin' in a corner somewhere?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERWOMAN03351
dialogue.text: I'm talkin' about my husband─clumsy, overcautious clod that he is.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERWOMAN03351
dialogue.text: All I asked was for him to bring some shellfish back for dinner, and he's been gone for bloody hours!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERWOMAN03351
dialogue.text: I hate to inflict my troubles on a stranger, but if you're headed down to the beach and spot my good-for-nothin' husband, tell him to get a move on with the main course!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERWOMAN03351
dialogue.text: If you find yourself down on the sands for whatever reason, please keep an eye out for my missin' husband. Just look for the bloke what's shakin' at his own shadow.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERMAN03351
dialogue.text: Wh-Who are you? Wh-What do you want with me?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERMAN03351
dialogue.text: The wife's wondering where I am? H-Has it been that long...?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERMAN03351
dialogue.text: <sigh> I tried to dig up one of those tideclams that she likes─a good-sized one, too─but a claw shot out from under the sand and almost clipped my arm off...

dialogue.name: VILLAGERMAN03351
dialogue.text: Say, you seem the capable sort. Do...do you think you could lend me a hand?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERMAN03351
dialogue.text: Oh, thank you! You should be able to find the spot I was digging not far from the water. Just watch out for those snippers!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERMAN03351
dialogue.text: The clam I was trying to get was over there, closer to the water. We'll be feasting well tonight if you can claim it from those ghastly claws!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERMAN03351
dialogue.text: Y-You're not missing a limb or anything, are you?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERMAN03351
dialogue.text: Yes, look at the size of this thing! My wife will be well pleased.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERMAN03351
dialogue.text: She'll be mad that I had to ask for your help, but...ah, it'll be worth it when she sees the prize you claimed.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERMAN03351
dialogue.text: In fact, I'm sure she'll want to thank you in person. Come on─let's head back to the village!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERWOMAN03351
dialogue.text: My apologies, stranger─it seems my husband caused you more trouble than I expected.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERWOMAN03351
dialogue.text: Aye, you're a proper pain in the posterior, you are! Here, take this and drop it off at the Leaky Keel!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERWOMAN03351
dialogue.text: I hear you slew some shelled monster what came between him and that clam. A good thing, too─if he'd stood his ground, I'd be buryin' whatever parts of him was left.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERWOMAN03351
dialogue.text: Thank you... The man has his faults, but strike me if I don't love him all the same.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERWOMAN03351
dialogue.text: Now, I'd best be makin' somethin' to fill his belly when he comes back. A nice thick clam stew, I reckon!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERMAN03351
dialogue.text: Th-Thank you again, misssir. I might still be floundering about on the sands if it weren't for you.
